author: Redacci√≥n CDN
title: Bombardeos israel√≠es mataron a 92 personas en L√≠bano
text: El Ministerio liban√©s de Salud inform√≥ que bombardeos israel√≠es en L√≠bano mataron este jueves a 92 personas e hirieron a otras 153. Los ataques ¬´del enemigo israel√≠¬ª causaron la muerte de 40 personas en el sur de L√≠bano, 25 en la regi√≥n de Baalbek-Hermel (este), 23 en Bec√° (este) y 4 en la regi√≥n del Monte L√≠bano (centro-este), seg√∫n el ministerio. LE RECOMENDAMOS LEER: Bombardeos agravan la crisis humanitaria en L√≠bano La intensidad y frecuencia de los ataques han generado una situaci√≥n alarmante en todo L√≠bano, con hospitales y centros m√©dicos desbordados por la cantidad de heridos. As√≠ como las infraestructuras en varias de las zonas afectadas han sufrido graves da√±os. Dificultando el acceso a los servicios b√°sicos, como el agua y la electricidad, lo que agrava a√∫n m√°s la situaci√≥n humanitaria. Sin embargo, [gobierno liban√©s ](https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/L%C3%ADbano)ha condenado en√©rgicamente los ataques, acusando a Israel de violar el derecho internacional y de llevar a cabo una ofensiva desproporcionada que afecta principalmente a civiles. Adem√°s, ha hecho un llamado a la comunidad internacional para intervenir y detener la escalada de violencia que sigue aumentando la tensi√≥n en la regi√≥n. TE RECOMENDAMOS LEER: Organizaciones internacionales y organismos de derechos humanos tambi√©n han expresado su preocupaci√≥n por la [situaci√≥n en L√≠bano.](https://cdn.com.do/internacionales/bombardeos-de-israel-provoca-la-muerte-de-492-muertos-en-el-libano-incluidos-35-ninos/) Advirtiendo sobre el impacto devastador que este conflicto podr√≠a tener, no solo en t√©rminos de vidas humanas. Si no tambi√©n para la estabilidad del pa√≠s y de la regi√≥n en general. Con informaci√≥n de AFP.

author: AOL Staff
title: Ryan O'Neal's Son Patrick Says He's Planning a 'Celebration of Life' to Honor His Late Dad: 'Will Be Amazing'
text: Ryan O'Neal's Son Patrick Says He's Planning a 'Celebration of Life' to Honor His Late Dad: 'Will Be Amazing' Ryan O'Neal died at age 82 on Dec. 8 of ‚Äúcongestive heart failure,‚Äù according to a death certificate obtained by PEOPLE [Ryan O'Neal](https://people.com/ryan-oneal-life-in-photos-8413775)'s son [Patrick O'Neal](https://people.com/ryan-o-neal-remembered-hollywood-legend-full-stop-son-patrick-8413810) plans to memorialize his father after his [death at 82](https://people.com/ryan-o-neal-academy-award-nominated-love-story-star-dead-at-82-8413764). Days after the Love Story actor was [buried next to his longtime partner](https://people.com/ryan-oneal-buried-next-to-farrah-fawcett-in-los-angeles-8420197) [Farrah Fawcett](https://people.com/tag/farrah-fawcett/) in Los Angeles, Patrick shared an image to "Everyone who should be there will be there and it will be amazing, trust me. üî•," Patrick wrote. "This will be a tribute to the man, his family, his love of boxing, and his legendary career as an actor. I have my work cut out for me because Ryan took about 3 million photos and saved 700 thousand of them ü•∫" Photos of Ryan's burial service published by [The Daily Mail](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-12897215/Ryan-ONeal-buried-longtime-lover-Farrah-Fawcett-Love-Story-actor-farewelled-intimate-ceremony-Los-Angeles-ex-wife-Leigh-Taylor-Young-son-Patrick-death-82.html) showed Patrick in attendance at Pierce Brothers Westwood Village Memorial Park & Mortuary for the ceremony. Ryan's ex-wife Leigh Taylor-Young and actress Alana Stewart, a friend of Fawcett's, were also present. Related: [Ryan O'Neal Dead: Actor Reflected on Love Story's 50th Anniversary with Ali MacGraw in 2021 PEOPLE Interview](https://people.com/ryan-o-neal-dead-read-his-2021-people-interview-with-ali-macgraw-8413884) Patrick announced his father's death on Dec. 8, when he shared on "He is a Hollywood legend. Full stop," Patrick wrote at the time. He also shared a photo of a beach at sunset on his Instagram Story on Christmas Day as he wrote, "1st Christmas without my dad. Prayers up. We miss you." Never miss a story ‚Äî sign up for [PEOPLE's free daily newsletter](https://forms.dotdashmeredith.com/people-news-inline) to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Related: [Inside Ryan O'Neal and Farrah Fawcett's Love Story: 'I Loved Her with All My Heart'](https://people.com/inside-ryan-oneal-love-story-with-farrah-fawcett-8413818) Patrick is Ryan‚Äôs only son from his marriage to his Peyton Place costar, Leigh Taylor-Young. Ryan is also survived by his two children from his marriage to Joanna Moore: [Tatum O‚ÄôNeal](https://people.com/tag/tatum-oneal/) and Griffin O‚ÄôNeal; and his son with Fawcett: Redmond James Fawcett O‚ÄôNeal. After Ryan's death, his daughter and Paper Moon costar [Tatum honored her dad in a statement to PEOPLE](https://people.com/tatum-oneal-speaks-out-about-late-father-ryan-oneal-death-8413778). "I feel great sorrow with my father's passing," she said. "He meant the world to me. I loved him very much and know he loved me too. I'll miss him forever and I feel very lucky that we ended on such good terms." For more People news, make sure to [sign up for our newsletter!](https://forms.dotdashmeredith.com/people-apple-news-opt-in) Read the original article on [People](https://people.com/ryan-oneals-son-patrick-says-hes-planning-a-celebration-of-life-to-honor-his-late-dad-will-be-amazing-8420714).

author: Maria Rantanen
title: Bike patrols catch thieves, give out tickets in Richmond city centre
text: The Richmond RCMP Bike Patrol Unit has been in the city centre area during the holiday season, resulting in arrests and tickets. While out and about, they arrested a man allegedly stealing clothes and other items at a mall and another man who allegedly damaged a store door. They also arrested an ‚Äúextremely intoxicated man‚Äù and investigated a domestic disturbance. Over the holiday, bike patrol officers also found and arrested people in Richmond who had outstanding warrants and gave out tickets to drivers. According to RCMP, they have also been helping people who are in mental distress and have been able to patrol areas with a ‚Äúhigh concentration of the unhoused.‚Äù ‚ÄúMany of the businesses and members of the community have provided feedback on the presence of Bike Patrol officers in the area,‚Äù said Staff Sgt. Paul Maan. ‚ÄúIt has been overwhelmingly positive. Their unique capabilities and flexibility are unmatched in the urban environment.‚Äù Bike patrol officers can move ‚Äúquickly and quietly, covering greater distances than on foot,‚Äù explained Richmond RCMP media spokesperson Cpl. Adriana O‚ÄôMalley. ‚ÄúTheir stealthy nature often lends to the element of surprise with criminals not noticing them,‚Äù she added. Many officers bring extensive experience from other sections within the RCMP, O‚ÄôMalley explained. ‚ÄúThis includes knowing many of the offenders by appearance and name,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThey are keenly focusing on the downtown core of Richmond and areas along Bridgeport Road corridor to arrest criminals, deter suspicious activity and safeguard the community.‚Äù Help prevent crime: Police RCMP are asking the public to take precautions to prevent crime: - Lock your vehicle doors. Sounds simple. It takes less than a second to do so. It‚Äôs the first thing thieves do when they are on the prowl. It also takes them less than a second to check. - ‚ÄôTis the season to be shopping. Keep your valuables out of sight. If you can see them, thieves can as well. - Report any suspicious activity. Your eyes and ears are some of the greatest crime fighting tools available. Got an opinion on this story or any others in Richmond? [Send us a letter](https://www.richmond-news.com/submissions/letter-to-the-editor) or email your thoughts or story tips to [Editor@Richmond-News.com](mailto:Editor@Richmond-News.com).

author: Valerio Caruso
title: Interview: Antonio La Camera ‚Ä¢ Director of The Lost Memories of Trees - ‚ÄúBeing immersed in the Amazon was an inner journey to discover my limits and my strengths‚Äù - /Italy/Spain
text:
Antonio La Camera ‚Ä¢ Director of The Lost Memories of Trees
‚ÄúBeing immersed in the Amazon was an inner journey to discover my limits and my strengths‚Äù
- The Italian director participated in Playlab‚Äôs 2022 Creators Lab with Apichatpong Weerasethakul, where he shot his Venice-awarded short film
Italian director Antonio La Camera participated in
Playlab Films‚Äô Apichatpong Weerasethakul Creators Lab: Filming in the Amazon in 2022 (see the news), which took filmmakers and creatives to the Peruvian Amazon rainforest during ten days to develop a short film each. His effort, The Lost Memories of Trees, was one of the 15 selected by Playlab in order to support their international distribution, and was subsequently chosen for the 38th International Film Critics‚Äô Week at last year‚Äôs Venice Film Festival, winning the Award for Best Short in the section.
Cineuropa: How did the rich cultural heritage of the Peruvian Amazon and the influence of this specific culture inspire or impact your creative process during the Playlab Films workshop?
Antonio La Camera: Being immersed in the Peruvian Amazon rainforest was a great opportunity for me to reconnect with myself. More than being influenced by the local culture in the conventional sense, for me it was an inner journey to discover my limits and my strengths, in a great dialogue with the nature around us, which, in the Amazon, has a huge spiritual force and a unique atmosphere.
Having grown up in Italy, in the countryside, the relationship with nature has always been something that has really belonged to me, and finding myself immersed in the Amazon rainforest was a bit like a return to a home to which you belong, but which is, at the same time, different and new. I will never forget the starry night sky of the forest while the screeches of distant animals filled the air, creating an atmosphere that was earthly and alien at the same time. These are all suggestions that I tried to convey in my short film and which inspired me greatly.
Can you share some insights or key learnings from working with the famous director who led this year's workshop, and how did these experiences contribute to the development of your film?
Certainly, what I still carry with me from the workshop and from the teachings of a master like Apichatpong is having understood that to make a film, you have to take one step at a time. You have to have faith in the process, live very much in the present, and even the things that seem the most difficult and impossible will find a way to come true. Having ten days to conceive a film, write it, cast it, choose the locations, shoot it and then edit it would seem like something impossible or restrictive, but if you have faith in the process and are able to listen to what is happening outside and inside you, limitations can become strengths, and the possibilities multiply.
Presenting your film at the Venice Film Festival is a significant achievement. How did the intensive, ten-day workshop at Playlab Films prepare you for this milestone, and what feedback or reactions did you receive at the festival?
The presentation at Venice was a very important moment for me because it was the first time I saw the film finished in a theatre with hundreds of people. For me, it is important that films are not just films, but that they can aspire to become pure cinema - that is, to access an experiential dimension that embraces narrative and audiovisual form in order to create a true sensory journey. And of course, the movie theatre is the perfect place to create this dimension. So, at Venice, I was able to watch the film exactly as I hoped it would be, and the feedback from those in the theatre was very positive and emotional. So, it was proof that regardless of whether you like it or not, the film managed to get somewhere inside the viewer, and that for me is the most important thing.
Did you enjoy reading this article? Please subscribe to our newsletter to receive more stories like this directly in your inbox.

author: @wion
title: Pope encourages Ukraine to show ‚Äòwhite flag‚Äô courage in negotiations - World News
text: Pope encourages Ukraine to show ‚Äòwhite flag‚Äô courage in negotiations Story highlights Pope Francis emphasised a different perspective, stating that true strength lies in considering the well-being of the people and having the courage to negotiate. Pope Francis said that Ukraine should demonstrate what he referred to as the 'courage of the white flag' and engage in negotiations to end the ongoing conflict with Russia, which began with Moscow's full-scale invasion two years ago and has resulted in the loss of tens of thousands of lives. In a recent interview with Swiss broadcaster RSI, Pope Francis expressed his view on Russia-Ukraine war by engaging in negotiations to end the war with Russia. The interview took place last month, predating Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan's recent offer to host a summit between Ukraine and Russia to seek a resolution to the conflict. During the interview, Pope Francis responded to a question about the ongoing debate over whether Ukraine should surrender, given its challenges in repelling Russian forces. The term white flag was used in the question to describe a potential surrender. While acknowledging this interpretation, Pope Francis emphasised a different perspective, stating that true strength lies in considering the well-being of the people and having the courage to negotiate. He stressed the importance of international involvement in facilitating these talks. In his remarks, the Pope suggested that negotiating is a courageous act, especially when faced with adversity. He encouraged timely negotiations to prevent further escalation of the conflict, mentioning Turkey among the countries that could offer mediation. Last year the 87-year-old pope sent a peace envoy, Italian Cardinal Matteo Zuppi, to Kyiv, Moscow and Washington to sound out leaders in those countries. This interview marked the first time Pope Francis used terms such as white flag or defeated in discussing the Ukraine war. He reiterated the need for negotiations and expressed a willingness to mediate if required. In another part of the interview, Pope Francis drew a parallel to the conflict between Israel and Hamas, emphasising that negotiating should never be seen as surrender. The Ukrainian leader's own peace plan calls for the withdrawal of Russian troops from all of Ukraine and the restoration of its state borders. The Kremlin has ruled out engaging in peace talks on terms set by Kyiv. A spokesman for Volodymyr Zelensky did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the pope's remarks. (With inputs from agencies)

author: mdzol.com
title: El sorpresivo reclamo de los trabajadores sobre la Inteligencia Artificial
text: El sorpresivo reclamo de los trabajadores sobre la Inteligencia Artificial La IA est√° revolucionan muchos sectores y, en materia laboral, propone grandes desaf√≠os. Si bien puede generar p√©rdidas de empleos, tambi√©n ofrece beneficios para los trabajadores El mundo del trabajo est√° cambiando cada vez m√°s r√°pido y la llegada de la [inteligencia artificial](https://www.mdzol.com/temas/inteligencia-artificial-3428.html) genera un fuerte desaf√≠o en los trabajadores, pero tambi√©n en las empresas. No todas las compa√±√≠as se actualizan de la misma manera ante las nuevas tendencias y la incorporaci√≥n de empleados j√≥venes la ponen a prueba respecto a su capacidad para adaptarse a las nuevas corrientes. Un estudio realizado en 15 mercados, incluido Argentina, que indaga sobre la IA y su impacto en el [mercado laboral](https://www.mdzol.com/temas/mercado-laboral-13239.html), revel√≥ que la relaci√≥n empleador-empleado no siempre est√° alineados ante los desaf√≠os que imponen las nuevas tecnolog√≠as. Randstad, la compa√±√≠a de b√∫squeda de talentos a nivel global, present√≥ los resultados del informe Escasez de Talento, IA y Equidad. De ese trabajo surge que el 41% de los trabajadores argentinos considera que su empleador est√° retrasado en la adopci√≥n de IA y el 47% cree que su empleador podr√≠a obtener m√°s beneficios con un mayor uso de la IA en el lugar de trabajo. Al profundizar en el √∫ltimo punto, se remarca que el 47% de los trabajadores considera que la empresa en la que trabaja podr√≠a sacar mayor provecho del uso de la IA, mientras que el 29% se mantiene en una posici√≥n neutral y el 24% no percibe beneficios potenciales en una mayor adopci√≥n de la IA por parte de su empleador. "La IA est√° transformando muchas de las tareas que cotidianamente se realizan en el marco del trabajo, generando un impacto creciente en la forma en que trabajamos, en las habilidades que las organizaciones demandan y en las necesidades de formaci√≥n que requiere la fuerza laboral. En este contexto de cambio, en el que la escasez de talento se agudiza, es necesario asegurar el acceso equitativo a las habilidades, los recursos y las oportunidades para evitar la creaci√≥n de nuevas brechas", se√±ala el informe. Sobre este contexto, Andrea √Åvila, CEO de Randstad para Argentina, Chile y Uruguay, afirm√≥ que "la inteligencia artificial lleg√≥ para quedarse y su uso cada vez es m√°s com√∫n en el √°mbito laboral, ya sea porque las organizaciones la impulsan o porque los trabajadores se interesan por el fen√≥meno y experimentan con las nuevas herramientas. En un contexto de escasez estructural de talento, con brechas de adopci√≥n que ya se perciben, tenemos que tomar medidas activas para abordar la formaci√≥n de la fuerza laboral en habilidades digitales y de IA para que las desigualdades y las brechas de acceso no hagan m√°s cr√≠tica la escasez de talento en todo el mundo‚Äù. De esta forma, el 51% de los trabajadores en Argentina cree que la IA har√° m√°s f√°cil su trabajo; mientras el 24% no considera que facilitar√° sus labores y el 25% mantiene una posici√≥n neutral. Por su parte, el 48% de los trabajadores cree que la IA har√° su trabajo m√°s interesante; mientras que el 26% no considera que la IA vaya a hacer sus tareas m√°s interesantes y el 27% de los encuestados en Argentina toma una posici√≥n neutra al respecto. Por su parte, el Grupo Adecco, empresa en consultor√≠a integral en Recursos Humanos, indag√≥ acerca del impacto de la Inteligencia Artificial en el √°mbito laboral, analizando los primeros indicios de aumento de la eficiencia gracias a la IA. Para esto, se encuest√≥ a 35.000 trabajadores de todo el mundo, incluyendo a 1.000 argentinos. El dato importante que se vio reflejado en el estudio es que el ahorro promedio para los trabajadores que utilizan IA es de 1 hora al d√≠a, aunque una quinta parte de los usuarios afirm√≥ que la tecnolog√≠a les ahorraba hasta 2 horas al d√≠a. El 5% afirm√≥ que les ahorraba entre 3 y 4 horas al d√≠a. El ahorro de tiempo parece consistente y homog√©neo en todos los sectores. El √°rea de energ√≠a, servicios p√∫blicos y tecnolog√≠as limpias report√≥ el mayor ahorro de tiempo con 75 minutos al d√≠a, mientras que en el sector aeroespacial y defensa el ahorro es menor, con 52 minutos. Los trabajadores de tecnolog√≠a, servicios financieros y manufactura ahorran entre 57 y 66 minutos. Pese a esto, los trabajadores est√°n cada vez m√°s preocupados por un futuro incierto, siendo las condiciones econ√≥micas y la seguridad laboral las principales prioridades. El 13% inform√≥ haber perdido su empleo debido a la IA mientras que el 40% est√° preocupado por la estabilidad laboral a largo plazo y el 83% planea quedarse en su empleo actual;. El 51% considera que la IA ampl√≠a sus oportunidades laborales y el 46% considera que la IA les ha brindado m√°s oportunidades para aprender y progresar en sus trabajos Fallo judicial El r√©gimen especial por el cual Robledo Puch podr√≠a recuperar la libertad Pron√≥stico Se viene un viernes de calor asfixiante: de cu√°nto ser√° la m√°xima Pron√≥stico Alerta por lluvia, vientos fuertes y Zonda: qu√© provincias se ver√°n afectadas Educaci√≥n Salta refuerza la seguridad en escuelas tras incidentes con gas Conflicto aeron√°utico El gremio de los controladores a√©reos levant√≥ el paro del s√°bado Turismo porte√±o r√©cord CABA espera 132 mil turistas en el fin de semana largo: qu√© hay para hacer Encuesta Entr√° y vot√°: ¬øMendoza es la provincia m√°s feliz para vivir? Viral
